text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Jason a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Dallas Texas
today I'm going to show you how to
troubleshoot AWS resource permission
errors in Amazon quicksite let's get
started when editing the quicksite
permissions to AWS Services you may find
changes can't be saved to solve this I
will show you how to remove the manage
policies that quick site attaches to the
service rules and restore quick site
access to your AWS Services after
logging into the AWS Management console
using an admin account navigate to the
IM
console in the navigation pane choose
roles search for the service Ro AWS
quicksite service Ro v0 or AWS quicksite
S3 consumers Ro v0 select the service
Ro choose
delete and confirm the deletion
now in the navigation pane choose
policies here search for the customer
manage policies that start with AWS
quick
site in the filter by type drop down
list filter by customer
managed select AWS quick site IM policy
choose
delete and then confirm the deletion by
entering the policy name in the text
input field
now let's do the same steps for the
remaining customer manage
policies to restore the quick site
access to your AWS services with a user
that has quick site admin privileges
navigate to quicksite
console in the navigation bar choose
your username to see the dropdown list
and then choose manage quick
site in the navigation pane choose
security and permissions and then choose
manage under quick site access to AWS
Services keep the user quick site
managed Ro default option selected check
the services that you want to allow
quick site to
access and then choose
save with this the quick site service Ro
is recreated along with the needed
policies to avoid hitting the same issue
again use only the quick site console to
edit quick site permission to AWS
resources and now you know how to
troubles shoot AWS resource permission
errors in Amazon quick site thanks for
watching and Happy Cloud competing from
all of us here at
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
AWS
